message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SE, cs.SY, cs.PL, cs.DS

The paper discusses probabilistic countermeasures against remote attacks on software with memory-safety vulnerabilities. This topic falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The paper also proposes a methodology for rigorously deriving security bounds for these countermeasures, which involves modeling security notions as events in probabilistic games. This methodology involves aspects of software engineering (cs.SE) and control systems (cs.SY). Additionally, the paper discusses the effectiveness of different countermeasures and their composition, which involves aspects of programming languages (cs.PL) and data structures (cs.DS).
